job_description: BAT is evolving at pace into a global multi-category business. Our purpose is to create A Better Tomorrow‚Ñ¢ by Building a Smokeless World.To achieve our ambition, we are looking for colleagues who are ready to join us on this journey! Tomorrow can‚Äôt wait, let‚Äôs shape it together!PURPOSE STATEMENTThe role is responsible for driving strategic pricing decisions, competitor analysis, and brand investment optimization to maximize profitability and market share. This role combines expertise in pricing strategy, competitor insights, and brand marketing finance to deliver actionable recommendations that support portfolio growth and activation effectiveness. The position acts as a key business partner to senior leadership, ensuring robust financial analysis and governance across marketing investments.WHAT YOU WILL BE ACCOUNTABLE FORBusinessDevelop and maintain financial models, budgets, and forecasts aligned with business key matrix. Monitor financial risks and recommend mitigation strategiesDevelop and implement pricing strategies using advanced models (price elasticity, affordability, CBC insights) to optimize profitability and market competitiveness.Forecast and monitor industry profit pools, competitor pricing, and portfolio mix to guide strategic decisions.Lead quarterly PET committee discussions and provide pricing recommendations aligned with long-term excise and portfolio strategies.Manage and optimize brand marketing investments, ensuring ROI and cost efficiency across activations.Collaborate with sales, marketing, and operations teams to support pricing strategies, product profitability, and investment appraisals and brand positioning to senior forumsDrive business cases and post-investment reviews for trade marketing and brand initiatives as well as new product launch/relaunchEnsure compliance with Marketing Governance Framework and internal control standards.PeopleProvide inspirational leadership and clear direction to MKT Finance TeamBuild strong collaborative relationships across Finance, Marketing, and Commercial teams.Coach and develop team capabilities, ensuring succession planning and high performance.ESSENTIAL EXPERIENCE, SKILLS AND KNOWLEDGEProfessional accounting qualification with strong financial background. Minimum 5 years‚Äô experience in FMCG or similar dynamic environment, with exposure to pricing and marketing finance. Commercially astute with strategic thinking capabilityStrong analytical, influencing, and problem-solving skills. Excellent communication and stakeholder management abilities. Proven leadership in managing teams and driving strategic initiatives.What we offer you?We offer a market leading annual performance bonus (subject to eligibility)Our range of benefits varies by country and includes diverse health plans, initiatives for work-life balance, transportation support, and a flexible holiday plan with additional incentivesYour journey with us isn't limited by boundaries; it's propelled by your aspirations. Join us at BAT and become a part of an environment that thrives on internal advancement, where your career progression isn't just a statement ‚Äì it's a reality we're eager to build together. Seize the opportunity and own your development; your next chapter starts here.You'll have access to online learning platforms and personalized growth programs to nurture your leadership skillsWe prioritise continuous improvement within a transformative environment, preparing for ongoing changesWHY JOIN BAT?We‚Äôre one of the few companies named as a Global Top Employer by the Top Employers Institute ‚Äì certified in offering excellent employee conditions.Collaboration, inclusion and partnership underpin everything we do here at BAT. We are looking forward to enabling every individual to thrive, regardless of gender, sexual orientation, marital or civil partnership status, gender reassignment, race, religion or belief, colour, nationality, ethnic or national origin, disability, age, skills, experience, education, socio-economic and professional background, veteran status, perspectives and thinking styles. We know that embracing talent from all backgrounds is what makes us stronger and best prepared to meet our business goals.We see the career breaks as opportunities not obstacles. Through The Global Returners program, we support professionals looking to restart their careers after an extended absence from the workforce (e.g. time out caring for family, parental leave, national service, sabbatical and/or starting an own venture).Come bring your difference and see what is possible for you at BAT. Learn more about our culture and our award winning employee experience here.If you require any reasonable adjustments or accommodations to help you perform at your best during the recruitment process, you are encouraged to notify us. We are fully committed to support you by making appropriate arrangements for you to demonstrate your full potential. Show more Show less

job_description: Full-time Treatments Scheduling Coordinator at Thermea spa villageWe have taken the spa experience and transformed it into a wellness village. Thermea spa village is familiar, feels like home and allows its guests to escape the hectic pace of modern life. Our spa village is the first of its kind, with state-of-the-art installations and at its core, buildings reminiscent of a distant past, when life was strongly connected with nature and steeped in traditions. Our spa village, a twist on traditional spa culture, combines unique experiences inspired by rituals found around the globe with a distinctively Canadian character‚Äîa peaceful hideaway for our guests, not too far from home.We have a current opening for an Treatments Scheduling CoordinatorIt takes a village, join us. We pride our community on being one of the warmest and most welcoming‚Äîand, our guests truly do appreciate it. We go out of our way to provide excellent care to our guests, as well as our artisans.We are seeking a passionate Scheduling Coordinator in Whitby, Ontario to join our village.Find your place at Thermea spa village.What We Stand ForOur mission is to give our guests a moment‚Äôs rest by offering them refuge, away from the pressures of modern life where they may rediscover their own well-being and, as a result, live a happier and longer life. Your role as an artisan of our spa village is to cultivate peace. We are passionate and dedicated team players here at Thermea spa village. Always enthusiastic, helpful, conscientious, discrete‚Äîand most of all, respectful. We deeply care about everyone‚Äîguests and fellow artisans alike‚Äîin our wellness village.What We NeedUnder the direction of the Manager, Massage & Treatments, the Treatments Scheduling Coordinator is responsible for scheduling and supporting the administrative needs of all massage therapists and estheticians while respecting availability and operational needs for the coming months; in accordance with established protocols.You will support the elevation of our culture through the lens of our pillars: The best in wellness | The feeling of somewhere else | A trouble-free experience | In a natural state.What You‚Äôll DoAssist in the maintenance of the administrative files of the self-employed workers: creation of computer access and files with the accounting department;Assist in the programming of the schedules of all Massage Therapists and Estheticians, taking into account the availability of workers and operational needs for the coming months;Monitor schedule changes (additions and deletions) and find solutions to cover emergencies and shortfalls;Contacting guests to reschedule/cancelAssist and support the management in maximizing the occupancy of the massage rooms;Follow up on various emails and administrative requests (time-off, insurance, etc.)Enter scheduling data into SpaBooker with a sense of precision and promptnessParticipate in the continuous improvement of departmental processes and proceduresFollow up with the accounting department for billing purposes;Processing RMT receipts for guestsPerform other related duties. Profile neededIn order to be successful in this position, you should have the following:Preferred education or equivalent experience in Hospitality, Health Administration, or Data Management; [JS7] One (1) year experience in managing schedule building and input for large teams;Experience in customer serviceExcellent MS Office skills (Excel, Word, Outlook);Strong ability to manage back-end data entry; Excellent verbal and written communication and interpersonal skills; Possess a good sense of organization, planning and monitoring, solution focused mindset, as well as great professional rigor;Ability to analyze and manage priorities;Have a positive attitude, resourcefulness, and calm under pressure;Respect confidentiality and discretion;Enjoys logic puzzles and problem-solving games;Experience with SpaBooker or treatment/service focused software would be an asset. When You will work 40 hours per week (weekends and holidays required).CompensationAnnual compensation for the role is expected to be in the range of $40,000-$70,000 Free Thermal Experience *Health Insurance *HowSend us your resum√© and cover letter by clicking ‚ÄòApply‚Äô below.At Thermea spa village we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and guests feel valued, respected and supported. Accommodations are available upon request for candidates throughout the hiring process. If you require an accommodation, we will work with you to meet your needs.The use of AI may be applied during the recruitment process only to provide an overall job suitability score. It will not be used to choose or discard applicant

At METLEN Energy & Metals, we are catalysts for a sustainable future, positioned at the forefront of the energy transition while being a reference point for competitive green metallurgy at both the European and global levels. We are a global industrial and energy company operating across two highly interconnected and complementary sectors: Energy and Metals. With a consolidated turnover of ‚Ç¨5,683 million and an EBITDA of ‚Ç¨1,080 million, along with a workforce of over 7,627 dedicated individuals, we drive success through cutting-edge technology and diverse talent.We are committed to embracing new state-of-the-art technologies and advancements, propelling us towards a cleaner, brighter tomorrow. Our positive footprint extends across five continents, creating a lasting impact. At METLEN, we foster a culture of resilience, challenge, respect, excellence, and change, empowering our diverse workforce to achieve remarkable outcomes.We are currently looking for a Senior Accountant to join our Finance General Division team, based in Sofia, Bulgaria.Your role will encompass:Regular bookkeeping, manage full‚Äëcycle accounting for development and construction projects, review of balances and accounted transactions by verifying, allocating, posting, reconciling transactions, resolving any discrepancies.Prepare quarterly and annual financial statements in compliance with IFRS / Bulgarian GAAP, group consolidation reports.Review accounting documents to ensure accuracy of information and calculations, correct entries as required.Reconcile general ledger accounts (vendors, banks etc.) and perform month-end accounting activities.Control of internal reporting on intercompany transactions.Monthly review of Taxes (VAT, CIT, Other applicable taxes) in cooperation with the external advisor.Cooperate efficiently with all related departments to process financial information on time.Support assigned tasks for month and year-end close. Reconcile accounting records with monthly financial reports.Assist in auditing activities by providing necessary information and preparing requested documentation.Maintain and review company‚Äôs Asset register.Prepare analysis of accounts as requested and help resolve accounting discrepancies and irregularities.Reconciles the recognized revenue and costs to the respective construction contracts. Preparation of the accounts of the companies in the process of a potential sale. Support in the due diligence process by providing accounting related information and answers.What you bring to the role:At least 5 years of relevant work experience in a similar role is required.Holder of bachelor's in accounting and finance, economics, or another related field.ACCA/ACA Qualified is considered a benefit.Knowledge of IFRS and Bulgarian GAAP accounting rules, regulations, policies, and procedures required.Proficiency in Microsoft Office tools.Well organized and able to prioritize and comply with deadlines.Share the same Value Based Behaviors:People & Personal growthResults orientation & Safety excellenceCollaboration & TrustEmpathy & Effective communicationFlexibility & AdaptabilityYour Benefits:Competitive remuneration packageMedical Insurance programFood vouchersMulti-Sport Card25 days annual leaveCooperation, creativity and innovation: we adopt flexible cooperation models to achieve fast results and increased productivityFollow us on LinkedIn and stay updated on our latest newsWe respect your personal data. All personal information in your application and CV will remain strictly confidential.At Metlen Energy & Metals we are proud to have Diversity and Inclusion at the centre of everything we do. We are committed to Equal Employment Opportunity regardless of race, colour, national origin, ethnicity, gender, age, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or religion.

A global organization within the natural resources and industrial sector is seeking an International Tax Manager to join its corporate tax team. This role offers significant exposure to complex, cross-border tax matters and the opportunity to influence tax strategy across multiple jurisdictions. It is well suited for a tax professional who enjoys working in a dynamic, globally integrated environment and partnering with senior stakeholders.Reporting to a senior leader within the corporate tax function, this role will play a key part in delivering group-wide tax compliance, planning, and risk management initiatives.What You'll DoLead tax matters related to corporate holding structures across multiple jurisdictions, covering direct and indirect taxes, transfer pricing, and international tax considerationsManage relationships with external tax authorities, advisors, and internal business partners across finance, treasury, legal, and governance functionsSupport and oversee tax compliance and reporting obligations, including monitoring legislative changes and assessing their impactProvide guidance on tax risk management, including improving tax processes, documentation, and internal controlsResearch and evaluate complex tax issues, preparing clear position papers and recommendations for senior leadershipSupport tax structuring for strategic transactions, joint ventures, and internal reorganizationsPlay a lead role in international tax planning initiatives, including intercompany financing and cash repatriation strategiesContribute to the development and implementation of global tax policy initiatives, including emerging international minimum tax and transparency requirementsMentor and support regional or site-based tax resources, building capability across the broader organizationWhat You BringBachelor‚Äôs degree in accounting, finance, law, economics, or a related disciplineProfessional designation in accounting or tax (or equivalent professional qualification)Approximately 7+ years of progressive experience in corporate or international tax, gained in industry and/or professional servicesStrong technical foundation in at least one major tax jurisdiction, with a solid understanding of international tax principlesDemonstrated experience with tax structuring, cross-border financing, and complex international tax mattersExperience interacting with tax authorities and managing audits, disputes, or controversyAbility to translate technical tax issues into practical guidance for non-tax stakeholdersStrong communication, analytical, and stakeholder management skillsExperience in capital-intensive or asset-heavy industries is an asset, but not requiredAdditional language skills are considered an advantageWhy JoinThis is an opportunity to join a globally connected, high-performing tax team where your work will have a direct impact on major business decisions. The environment is fast-paced, collaborative, and intellectually challenging, with exposure to senior leadership and complex international projects. The organization encourages independent thinking, continuous improvement, and professional growth, offering long-term development opportunities for motivated individuals.

What You Will Do You will perform invoice checking, billing support, and overdue tracking using ExcelYou will maintain and update monthly finance reports with accuracy and completenessYou will support basic financial reporting and data preparation for managementYou will ensure proper documentation and record-keeping for finance-related activitiesYou will provide administrative support including coordination, follow-ups, and documentationYou will maintain organized records, trackers, and reportsYou will support internal communication between finance, operations, and other teamsYou will assist with other finance and admin-related tasks as assignedYou will prepare, maintain, and organize finance and administrative documentation, ensuring accuracy and easy retrievalWho You Are You have a Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Business Administration, Finance, Accounting, or a related fieldYou have at least 2 years of experience in an accounts or administrative finance roleYou are detail-oriented, well-organized, and reliableYou have good communication skills, both written and verbalYou are comfortable learning and using new tools and systems, including AI-based toolsYou are proactive and able to manage routine tasks independentlyWhat You Can ExpectA competitive salary structure.An exceptional working environment with supportive peers and mentors.Health insurance privileges.Breakfast and Lunch at the office.Monthly team events.Lots of challenges and even more scope to implement your ideas.

Job Title: Supply Chain Process Analyst - ContractLocation: Great Toronto AreaAbout Us:Welcome to Lactalis Canada ‚Äì where we take pride in being recognized as one of 2026 GTA's Top Employers! As well as one of Forbes Canada, Top Canadian Employer for 2026! Our journey revolves around enhancing the lives of Canadians through a rich variety of dairy delights, including some of Canadian‚Äôs favourite dairy brands such as like Black Diamond Cheese, Lactantia Milk, Astro Yogurt, Balderson Cheese, and Cheestrings. In fact, we‚Äôre proud to say our products grace the shelves of an incredible 94% of Canadian households!With a 140-year legacy driven by innovation and unwavering quality, we‚Äôre seeking like-minded individuals to join us in shaping our next chapter. Our flexible hybrid work model accommodates 40% remote work, adapting to the evolving needs of our workforce. Step into a collaborative hub with our revamped office, and enjoy free parking, endless coffee, delicious Lactalis snacks, an on-site gym, and more!About the opportunity:The Process Analyst is responsible for deploying, controlling, and maintaining accurate documentation of supply chain processes. This role involves evaluating, measuring, executing, monitoring, and controlling business processes to enhance overall performance, and identifying areas for cost, productivity, or compliance improvements. Additionally, the Process Specialist supports the certification and audit process as needed.The attributes we are looking for:Document Management. Ensure all Supply Chain IT systems' processes are documented and properly stored, categorized, and accessible. Define a review period and/or update documentation as required to ensure that it is maintained and up to date.Supply Chain Certification. Support the Supply Chain team in new facility start-ups, audits, and re-certification of all relevant certifications aligned with Lactalis Canada Quality Team.Compliance: Run regular reporting and perform internal audits to ensure process compliance and implement corrective action plans for non-compliance. Support internal and external audits as required.Evaluation of Current Processes: Review and analyze existing processes to identify gaps, opportunities for cost savings, increased productivity, and compliance with business standards.Develop and Implement Process Change: Design with the direction of the process owner, and implement new procedures to enhance productivity, accuracy, and compliance.Training and Support. Develop and facilitate training and resource guides to support key users on documented processes, ensuring consistency across the supply chain network. Promote the adoption of new systems and processes to achieve expected outcomes.Project Work. Support project implementation by participating in defining the scope the work, identifying potential issues, and training key users to adopt new systems and processes effectively.What you will bring:University degree or College diploma in Business Management, IT or equivalent experienceIntermediate level in CGA/CMA program preferredMinimum 1 - 3 years Supply Chain experienceAbility to quickly grasp new concepts of business processes and information systemsSelf-motivated, resourceful and with a methodical, thorough approach to researching all aspects of an issueStrong analytical and problem-solving skillsWell-developed communication and interpersonal skillsAbility to work independently as well as in a team environmentAbility to work under pressure and meet tight deadlinesAbility to operate standard office applications such as Microsoft Office programs, MS Outlook, MS Teams, with advanced MS Excel skills. This job description is intended to summarize the overall level of responsibility of the job and is not an exhaustive list of all the duties performed.What Lactalis will offer:Lactalis Canada believes in rewarding its people with the following comprehensive benefits package and perks:A Competitive Base SalaryA Performance-Based Bonus System4 Weeks of VacationBenefits starting day 1A Pension Program with an Employer Match at 100% of up to 6%Tuition reimbursement plan of up to $3,000/yearA Volunteer Day to give back to your communityLearning and Development opportunitiesA commitment to internal career advancement with potential for international mobilityOur ESG commitment:Our ESG (Environmental, Social, and Governance) roadmap drives our sustainability mission. We aim to positively impact communities and the planet by enabling stakeholders including our people, consumers, customers, suppliers, dairy farmers, government, and industry partners to have a positive impact on the wellbeing of our communities and the planet through all that we do.At Lactalis Canada, we value our employees as catalysts for positive change. Together, we will create a sustainable future, promote belonging, and make a lasting impact on the world.Our commitment to DEI:Fuel Our Culture with Your Uniqueness! Lactalis thrives on the value each perso

job_description: We are a top 10 professional services firm in Bulgaria and an independent member of Crowe Global, offering audit, advisory, accounting, tax, and HR services. Backed by a team of certified professionals and a client-focused approach, we serve over 250 international and local clients. As we continue to grow, we are seeking an Audit Manager to join our dynamic team.Principal Duties And ResponsibilitiesÔÄ¥ Be responsible for planning audit engagements and preparation of audit strategy including scheduling audits, tailoring of audit procedures and appropriate addressing of risks;ÔÄ¥ Understand the audit client's industry and recognize key performance drivers and business trends while staying informed of general business/economic developments and their impact to the audit client;ÔÄ¥ Be responsible for timely execution and completion of audit;ÔÄ¥ Defining project structure and assessing and assuring proper resource allocation;ÔÄ¥ Delivering projects on-time and on-budget;ÔÄ¥ Demonstrate ability to high quality performance of audit engagements along with ensuring deliverables meet work plan specifications and deadlines;ÔÄ¥ Develop and maintain effective communication with Client management at each stage of the audit engagement and contribute to a strong and positive client relationship through interactions with client personnel;ÔÄ¥ Acting as a role model and mentor for less experienced members of the team providing on the job training and developing, through evaluation and counseling talented team members.Position RequirementsÔÄ¥ Minimum experience of 5 years in audit;ÔÄ¥ Extensive knowledge of IFRS and Bulgarian tax legislation;ÔÄ¥ University degree in Accounting, Finance or Engineering;ÔÄ¥ Certificate in accounting and auditing (ACCA or CPA) is an advantage;ÔÄ¥ Fluent in English including reading, speaking and writing;ÔÄ¥ Excellent computer literacy including Microsoft Office - Word, Excel and Power point.ÔÄ¥ Excellent business communication etiquette;ÔÄ¥ Excellent organizational and prioritization skills;ÔÄ¥ Team player with strong interpersonal, communication and project management skillsÔÄ¥ Leadership and integrityWe OfferÔÄ¥ Progressive career development options, including partnership;ÔÄ¥ Working with top international companies and gaining multicultural experience;ÔÄ¥ Pleasant, team-oriented and supportive work environment;ÔÄ¥ Participation in a wide range of international, professional and pleasure events;ÔÄ¥ Full financial and training support in professional development qualification;ÔÄ¥ Premium remuneration.

job_description: MKP DESIGNERS CO LTD is looking for QC (Knitting & Sweater)Job Description / ResponsibilityEnsure quality control of knitting and sweater products in accordance with buyer requirements and company standards.Inspect raw materials (yarn, accessories) before production to ensure quality compliance.Monitor in-line and final inspection processes to identify defects and take corrective actions.Check knitting structure, GSM, measurements, workmanship, and finishing quality.Ensure proper implementation of approved samples, tech packs, and specifications.Coordinate with production, knitting, linking, washing, and finishing teams to resolve quality issues.Prepare and maintain inspection reports, quality records, and daily production status.Ensure AQL standards are followed during final inspection.Identify root causes of defects and support continuous quality improvement.Communicate effectively with management and merchandising teams regarding quality status.Ensure on-time shipment by maintaining required quality standards.Follow factory compliance, safety, and buyer code of conduct.Educational RequirementsSkills Required: All kinds of Garments (KnitWovenSweater)Experience Requirements3 to 4 year(s)The applicants should have experience in the following business area(s):Buying HouseJob LocationDhaka (DOHS Baridhara)SalaryTk. 20000 - 25000 (Monthly)
